item.description:
It works fine for me on my WordPress 2.1 based blog on SVN trunk revision 4021.

What revision are you running? You can find out by typing svn info.

item.description: Why would people use the RSS importer instead of the WP XML importer, and why should e duplicate code between them?

item.title: rss.php.diff attached to Ticket #2957
item.dc:creator: swillison
item.description: Patch adding wp:comment support to the RSS importer.

item.title: Ticket #2957 ([patch] RSS importer doesn't import Wordpress.com comments) created
item.dc:creator: swillison
item.description:
The RSS importer included with WordPress doesn't import <wp:comment>s, as exported by Wordpress.com. I've patched the importer to handle those comments, and refactored it a tiny bit as well.

Note that the importer still uses regular expressions to parse the XML - this is non-optimal as it may break with nested tags (or an RSS feed that uses different XML namespaces). I didn't fix that as I wasn't sure what the preferred namespace-aware XML parser for PHP is these days.

item.title: 2926.diff attached to Ticket #2926
item.dc:creator: Arrrr
item.description: Adds ksort() to page_template_dropdown() so that the templates are sorted there as well.
